England

Group G | Europe

Bangers & Mash

The stereotype that English food is bland and that English football is brutish is proved false by this BBC Bangers & Mash dish and the 2018 English World Cup team. This onion gravy will have your shouting along to "God Saves the Queen" on the touchline.

With Harry Kane to bang goals into the back of the net and a star-studded defense to mash all oncoming attacks, could this be the Three Lions year?

  • Time 1hr
  • Makes 2
  • Difficulty Semi-Pro
  • Units Imperial Metric

Ingredients

  • 4 English style sausages
    4
    4
    English style sausages
  • &frac14; tsp Dried thyme
    ¼ tsp
    ¼ tsp
    Dried thyme
  • &frac14; tsp Dried rosemary
    ¼ tsp
    ¼ tsp
    Dried rosemary
  • 1 tsp English mustard
    1 tsp
    1 tsp
    English mustard
  • 600ml Beef stock
    2 ½ cups
    600ml
    Beef stock
  • 2 Onions
    2
    2
    Onions thinly sliced
  • 900g Potatoes
    2lb
    900g
    Potatoes peeled, quartered
  • 125ml Milk
    ½ cup
    125ml
    Milk
  • 85g Butter
    6 tbsp 2 tbsp
    85g 28g
    Butter softened
  • 2 tsp Flour
    2 tsp
    2 tsp
    Flour
  • 175g Peas
    6oz
    175g
    Peas canned or frozen
  • 1
    Preheat oven to 400°F200°C. Place the sausages in a cast iron pan, or a deep baking dish, in the over for 15 minutes. Turning after the first ten.
  • 2
    While the sausages are baking, mix the thyme, rosemary and mustard into the beef stock.
  • 3
    Remove the pan from the oven and add the onions and stock mixture. Season with salt & pepper and return to over for 20 minutes.
  • 4
    Bring a pan of water to a boil. Clean, peel and cut the potatoes into quarters. Add to the water and cook until tender, about 15 minutes.
  • 5
    When cooked, drain the potatoes. Add 4 tbsp57g of butter and the milk to the potatoes, and mash together. Set aside.
  • 6
    Take the pan from the oven, remove the sausages and seat aside. Add the rest of the butter and the flour to the gravy, mix well and continue cooking until gravy thickens.
  • 7
    Serve the sausages and onion gravy over the mash, with peas on the side.
    Coach's tip Defrost frozen peas in warm water, or heat canned peas over low heat.
    Coach's tip Defrost frozen peas in warm water, or heat canned peas over low heat.
